image.altText: Lia Finocchiaro, Andrew Barr and Elizabeth Lee.

props.synopsis: Could the surprise devastation witnessed in the Northern Territory election a few months ago foreshadow a similar result in the ACT this weekend, or is the shared "territory" label where the similarities between the NT and the ACT end?

title.children: Labor was ousted in the NT election — does it offer a lesson for the ACT?

image.altText: A ni-Vanuatu man poses with his daughter, who is wearing a bright pink dress

props.synopsis: A former striker for Vanuatu's national youth soccer team drowned in a dam while on the job in Australia. He's one of at least 84 Pacific seasonal workers who have died here since 2020.

title.children: At least 84 Pacific seasonal workers have died in four years. Their families are often left empty-handed

image.altText: A teenage boy's hands on a table. He is fidgeting, wrapping fingers around his thumb.

props.synopsis: The boy, who was incarcerated in Perth's Banksia Hill Detention Centre and faced 36 criminal charges, has been released from custody without further penalties. A magistrate described him as WA's "most vulnerable child".

title.children: 'State's most vulnerable child': 11yo WA boy released after a total 77 days in custody

image.altText: Sue wears a bright red shirt and matching red rimmed glasses, she smiles widely at the camera from behind her desk.

props.synopsis: Sue Wright has been recognised for her significant contribution to Australia's transport industry, but as a woman in a male-dominated field she has overcome plenty of prejudice in the spare parts world.

title.children: This road transport hall of famer has been setting truckies straight for more than 50 years

image.altText: A family photo with four people - Danniel, his two children and his wife Caitland on a white bed smiling.

props.synopsis: A Brisbane inquiry has heard that four defence members killed in a defence helicopter crash were experiencing "hazardous" fatigue levels.

title.children: Brisbane inquiry into fatal army helicopter crash reveals men were flying at 'hazardous' fatigue levels

image.altText: A seawall damaged in a storm.

props.synopsis: Roads and beaches on the tropical Cocos (Keeling) Islands in the Indian Ocean remain shut, but a rising tide and further high swells have officials worried that the worst is yet to come.

title.children: 'Absolute freak' swells topple seawalls, bury beaches on Australia's most remote territory

image.altText: Woman stands in bunch holding a bunch of documents

props.synopsis: Darwin woman Toni Grant was shocked when she received a call from a stranger telling her they'd found personal records containing her mobile number, tax file number and medical information in a pile of rubbish in bushland. Similar documents belonging to others were also found.

title.children: Toni's personal information was found dumped in the bush. She's been looking for answers ever since

image.altText: What appears to be the feet of a male, following someone in high heels in a dark environment with shadows.

props.synopsis: A Personal Safety Survey, released by the Australian Bureau of Statistics, has found an estimated 2.7 million Australians have been stalked, with women more likely to be followed by a man they know.

title.children: One in five Australian women have been stalked, according to new data

image.altText: The clasped feet of a ten-month-old baby boy on a blue rug.

props.synopsis: The national birth rate has hit a record low and is now at a critical level, with economic consequences for the future.

title.children: Australia's 'perilously low' birth rate approaches point of no return

image.altText: Storm clouds brewing at night, with shades of blue and green, over green pastures

props.synopsis: A spell of wild weather is on the cards for everywhere from Queensland to Tasmania, with thunderstorms forecast to sweep across Australia's east over the next 48 hours.

title.children: Wild weather predicted across Australia's south-east over next 48 hours

image.altText: Recording artist Sean "Puff Daddy" Combs, ring detail, attends the grand opening weekend at Omnia Nightclub

props.synopsis: Sean "Diddy" Combs will for now remain in one of America's most notorious prisons as a case is built against the music mogul. However, what happens next as more accusers come out remains anyone's guess.

title.children: Enablers, helpers, backers. Why the charges against Sean 'Diddy' Combs could have far-reaching implications

image.altText: M1A1 Abrams tank

props.synopsis: The announcement was welcomed by Ukraine's ambassador to Australia, Vasyl Myroshnychenko.

title.children: Australia will send 49 old tanks to Ukraine, more than a year after they first asked for them

image.altText: A local resident and a rescuer stand on debris of a building.

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian president tells politicians his plan contains five main points that rely on Kyiv's allies, including an unconditional invitation to join NATO and specific weapons support.

title.children: Zelenskyy unveils victory plan as Russia reports capture of two Ukrainian villages

image.altText: The 23andMe logo seen on a smartphone.

props.synopsis: In what now seems like an act of reckless naivety, I bought my brother a 23andMe at-home DNA-test birthday present. Now the struggling company may sell its treasure trove of genetic data.

title.children: Eight years ago, my brother gave his DNA to 23andMe. We can't take it back — and it may soon get sold

image.altText: A grey and white little fluffy Greater gliders on a gum tree  branch looking ahead with big round eyes and a long fluffy tail.

props.synopsis: Logging is set to continue in areas where hundreds of endangered gliders have been sighted, despite conservationists warning the government regulator of their presence.

title.children: Logging set to continue in areas where hundreds of endangered gliders are present

image.altText: Liam Hooper sits at a cafe table on a city street.

props.synopsis: Staring at a third recession in just two years, Kiwis are moving across the ditch to Australia in substantial numbers, seeking a sunnier economic climate.

title.children: New Zealand's economic woes lure thousands of Kiwis to Australia

image.altText: A woman sits on a bench looking at a photograph. The faces in the photo are blurred.

props.synopsis: A mother whose son suffered repeated sexual abuse as a child was shocked to find his abuser exhibiting at the Perth Royal Show — now she's demanding changes to stop offenders working at shows around the country.

title.children: This mother was horrified to see son's abuser working at the Perth Royal Show, where background checks aren't required

image.altText: Dan Houston of the Power celebrates victory, raising his arms above his head

props.synopsis: After a week and a half of furrowed brows and frantic paperwork, the dust has begun to settle on a new footy future for all 18 AFL clubs.

title.children: How to assess which clubs improved or failed in the AFL trade period

image.altText: Liam Hooper sits at a cafe table on a city street.

props.synopsis: Staring at a third recession in just two years, Kiwis are moving across the ditch to Australia in substantial numbers, seeking a sunnier economic climate.

title.children: New Zealand's economic woes lure thousands of Kiwis to Australia

image.altText: An older man with a vibrant shirt sits by a kitchen bench with a sullen look on his face, holding a piece of paper

props.synopsis: Clients of Netstrata have told the ABC the strata firm has begun uploading years of invoices, with brokerage fees up to six times industry standard.

title.children: 'My jaw was hanging off': Mysterious invoices reveal exorbitant fees charged to apartment owners

image.altText: A generic stock photo of a teenage school girl leaning against the lockers on her phone.

props.synopsis: Online sugar daddy websites and apps promise to connect young "attractive" women with older "wealthy" men, but the message is being seen by teenage girls too.

title.children: 14yo joins sugar daddy app to make money but ends up at older man's house

image.altText: a pregnant woman lying on a couch holding her belly

props.synopsis: South Australia's upper house has narrowly voted down a proposal to amend abortion laws so that people who want to terminate their pregnancy after 28 weeks would be required to deliver their baby alive.

title.children: Late-term abortion bill defeated in SA's upper house

image.altText: Moon rising over hills on horizon.

props.synopsis: Our skies have already been graced by two supermoons this year but tonight's hunter's moon will be the brightest.

title.children: Everything to know about the year's brightest supermoon set to light up skies tonight

image.altText: A grey and white little fluffy Greater gliders on a gum tree  branch looking ahead with big round eyes and a long fluffy tail.

props.synopsis: Logging is set to continue in areas where hundreds of endangered gliders have been sighted, despite conservationists warning the government regulator of their presence.

title.children: Logging set to continue in areas where hundreds of endangered gliders are present

image.altText: Donald Trump smiles

props.synopsis: The Republican nominee and former US president also said some abortion bans in the US were "too tough" during the all-female town hall in Georgia.

title.children: Donald Trump calls himself the 'father of IVF' in attempt to court female voters in key election state

image.altText: Prince Charles and Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall, wave farewell before boarding a plane.

props.synopsis: King Charles is heading to Australia for his first royal visit since becoming king. Here's where you might catch a glimpse of royalty.

title.children: Here's where you can catch a glimpse of Charles and Camilla in Australia

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The Australian share market jumps to a fresh record high ahead of the latest ABS jobs data, while solid profit results from America's largest banks push Wall Street to its highest levels ever. Follow live.

title.children: ASX climbs to highest level ever ahead of jobs data, Dow Jones hits record high

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: AMP and uranium stocks jump, WiseTech shares plunge as CEO Richard White sues beauty entrepreneur
ASX starts its day with a fresh record high
Amazon is the latest tech company to sign nuclear power deal

image.altText: A young woman with dark brown hair smiles for a portrait.

props.synopsis: Easing the cost of living and making it more attainable for young people to buy a house will be the deciding factors for some young voters on October 26.

title.children: 'My future's been taken away': Concerns for young voters ahead of Queensland election

image.altText: Justice Gregory Geason looks off camera.

props.synopsis: Justice Gregory Geason has been on leave with pay for almost a year while he faced allegations of family violence, but the Tasmanian government appears to have no mechanism to suspend or remove him, even after his guilty verdict.

title.children: Judge guilty of causing concussion and bruising to a woman, but will remain on a $500,000 salary

image.altText: A woman and daughter sit side by side at a dining table, working on a laptop and tablet.

props.synopsis: Contrary to outdated beliefs, the majority of single mums are educated and in paid employment. So how do we bust the stigmas still facing single mothers?

title.children: Many single mothers have fled violent relationships, so why are these women still subject to negative stereotypes?

image.altText: a female snorkeller taking a photo of a turtle underwater

props.synopsis: The artificial intelligence used for passport facial scanning is now helping Australian conservationists track elusive sea turtles.

title.children: Conservationists keep tabs on sea turtles with the same face scanning tech used in airports

image.altText: a woman giving the finger at a man as he walks away

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Lee made the gesture towards a journalist at a press conference after the ACT Property Council's leaders' debate on Wednesday.

title.children: Canberra Liberals leader Elizabeth Lee makes rude gesture at journalist following tense press conference exchange

image.altText: A large grey kangaroo with a white kitchen bin lid stuck around its head.

props.synopsis: Wildlife rescuers in Victoria's Grampians region are reporting multiple cases of kangaroos getting their heads stuck in domestic kitchen bins and say it's because tourists are feeding them.

title.children: Tourists urged not to feed wildlife after spate of bin-diving kangaroo rescues
